message: I know that all browsers can cache javascript libs. But modern js engines compile javascript. Do they share those compiled versions between different tabs? Is there any sense to invent some kind of "*.dll for the web" technology, that will allow browsers to compile it once and run when they need it?
I mean a lot of sites use jQuery for example. Do browsers only cache javascript code, or they save something more?
http://code.google.com/p/v8/ read and watch that will explain everything
